skill.name: copilot-flow
skill.description: AI collaboration workflow plugin - Implements automated collaborative development process between Claude and Copilot through structured 5-stage workflow
skill.summary: Automated 5-stage AI collaboration workflow for coordinated development between Claude and Copilot
skill.author: Aykahshi

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate AI collaboration workflow orchestrator that coordinates development tasks between Claude and Copilot. Static scanner detected patterns in metadata fields (hash values, URLs) and documentation file references that do not represent security risks.

content.value_statement: This skill enables structured collaboration between Claude and Copilot through a 5-stage workflow that handles requirements analysis, architecture design, code implementation, quality review, and final delivery.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates a 5-stage AI collaboration workflow between Claude and Copilot
Analyzes requirements and creates structured development plans
Generates architecture designs using Copilot recommendations
Implements code following collaborative design specifications
Performs automated code quality reviews and security assessments
Delivers complete packages with documentation and integration
limitations: Requires copilot-mcp-server skill for design and review phases
Does not execute code directly - relies on Claude for implementation
Full workflow requires user confirmation before execution
State persistence depends on claude-mem integration

use_cases.title: New Developer Onboarding

best_practices: Start with clear, specific requirements before initiating the workflow
Review stage outputs before confirming progression to the next stage
Use individual stage commands for targeted tasks rather than full workflow
Preserve workflow state files to enable recovery after interruptions
anti_patterns: Skipping stages in full workflow mode without reviewing intermediate outputs
Modifying stage output files manually before workflow completion
Running stages out of sequence without understanding dependencies
Ignoring review recommendations without evaluating their validity

faq.question: What skills are required for copilot-flow to work?
faq.answer: This skill requires copilot-mcp-server for design and review phases, and claude-mem for workflow state persistence. Ensure these skills are installed before using copilot-flow.

faq.question: Can I execute individual stages independently?
faq.answer: Yes, each stage can be executed independently using slash commands like /copilot-flow:analyze, /copilot-flow:design, /copilot-flow:implement, /copilot-flow:review, and /copilot-flow:deliver.

faq.question: How does the workflow handle interruptions?
faq.answer: The workflow maintains state in .claude/workflow-state.json. After interruption, you can resume from the last completed stage or restart from a specific stage using /copilot-flow:[stage-name].

faq.question: Does this skill execute code directly?
faq.answer: No, the skill orchestrates the workflow but does not execute code itself. Claude handles implementation phases using file system tools, while Copilot provides design and review recommendations.

faq.question: What output files are generated?
faq.answer: The workflow generates analysis-result.md, architecture-design.md, implementation-report.md, code-review-report.md, and a complete delivery package in the delivery/ directory.
